intro: Diplacrum caricinum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daisy. It is a flowering plant native to Australia, characterized by its small, daisy-like white flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant belongs to the family Asteraceae and is typically found in dry, sandy soils. It has a low-growing habit and is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value. Diplacrum caricinum is also valued for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
